famous for the ruins of a Mayan city dating from about 600 to 800 CE. Set amidst thick trees, Palenque still evokes some of the wonder that the early Spanish visitors must have felt when they first came across the ruins.
Palenque is a medium-sized archaeological site, much smaller than Tikal or Copán, but it contains some of the finest sculpture, architecture, roof combs, and bas-relief carvings of the Mayan era.
, about two hours away by road.
is five to six hours away by bus. Both airports are well serviced with flights from
The easiest way to get to Palenque is by bus. There are many buses daily from
(13 hours). Daily (one or two buses) also ply from

(12 hours).

It is also possible to get to Palenque from
in Guatemala by bus (6h, leaving Flores daily at 5am, US$35).

The ruins are about 6 km from the town of Palenque and minibuses run between the town and ruins every 10 to 15 minutes during the day. Combis - shared taxis - are also available. Just wait at the park gate at El Panchan. A colectivo will pick you up.
You can get some Maya-style artwork from outdoor vendors who set up unobtrusively at the ruins.
Sleeping accomodation can be found either in the city of Palenque, or just outside the limits on the road to the national park.

value: content=It is relatively near the ruins and has cabanas and small cabins and common sleeping areas with hammocks. A cabana with access to a common showers and bathrooms facility is 80 pesos, approximately 8 USD. The little Otulum river runs through the location.
price=Dorms M$70, Camping M$30, Cabaña (for 4) from M$200
content=Offers mixed budget accomodation from camping, dorms, and small cabañas all with shared bathroom. Showers have hot water.

content=Very friendly, clean, but not super cheap. They have icey cold airconditioned rooms, a bare necessity after hiking through the ruins at Palenque during rainy (and pretty much all other) season(s).
address=2a. Avenida Sur Pte (Av. 20 de Noviembre)
directions=In the city center at the corner where the colectivos for the ruins leave
content=Very friendly, clean budget spot in the town of Palenque. Laundry, free internet and WIFI. Hot water (also in dorms). Baggage locker 10MX/day.

Don Muchos is a great restaurant at El Panchan as well. Great stone-oven pizza's and live music. The stone-oven pizza's cost 60 pesos and are very good.
